content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find updates for Apple Watch Series 7,8,9 on Apple's website.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find updates for Apple Watch Series 7, 8, and 9, I should navigate to the "Watch" section on Apple's website. The "Watch" link is clearly visible in the navigation bar.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I do not see references to Apple Watch Series 7, 8, or 9 in the visible Apple Watch models; only the newer models (Series 11, SE 3, Ultra 3, etc.) are displayed. I should scroll down to see if there is information or updates about older (7, 8, 9) Series.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible product lineup only shows the latest Apple Watch models (Series 11, SE 3, Ultra 3); there are no updates or references for Series 7, 8, or 9 in this section. I should continue scrolling down to check if information about older models is available further down the page.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is a "Next Apple Watch compare gallery" button visible, which likely allows navigation to compare or view older Apple Watch models (potentially Series 7, 8, 9). This could help locate any updates or status information about those series.
Action: Click [8]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The content of the compare gallery did not update to show more models like Series 7, 8, or 9 after clicking "Next." It's possible I have reached the end or there is only one set of models in the gallery. To confirm, I can try scrolling down further to see if any more models or additional information about older series is available farther down the page.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section shows shopping options (Apple Card installments, trade-in offers, delivery), but there is still no mention of updates for Apple Watch Series 7, 8, or 9. To find any updates, I should continue scrolling further down the page in case more product details or legacy product updates are listed below.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The section "Get to know Apple Watch" has just appeared. This area may provide more detailed information about various models, features, and possibly links to updates for older series like 7, 8, and 9. I should scroll down further to view the content in this section.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section provides information about Health, Fitness, and Safety features on the Apple Watch, but there is still no specific information or updates related to Apple Watch Series 7, 8, or 9 visible. I should scroll further down to continue searching for details or links to legacy model updates.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section is focused on "Apple Watch essentials" and accessories, not on software or model updates for Series 7, 8, or 9. The gallery navigation button labeled "Next Get to know Apple Watch gallery" could potentially reveal more relevant information about Apple Watch models, including past series.
Action: Click [3]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Get to know Apple Watch" gallery appears to have more entries accessible via the "Next" button, which might provide further information about different models or updates for legacy series (7, 8, 9). Progressing in the gallery is likely to yield more relevant content.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clicking "Next Get to know Apple Watch gallery" again may display additional information or sections in the gallery, possibly covering more models or relevant updates for the Series 7, 8, 9. Progressing further in the gallery remains a logical step.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.88
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clicking "Next Get to know Apple Watch gallery" again has not visibly changed the content in the gallery, suggesting that there may be no additional slides or that the section is stuck on the last gallery item. To continue the search for updates on Series 7, 8, 9, I should scroll further down the page.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.77
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section is about shopping for Apple Watch bands and does not mention updates or information about Series 7, 8, or 9. To continue my search for model updates, I should scroll further down the page.

Thought: This "Made for each other" section describes Apple Watch and iPhone features but does not provide any update information about Series 7, 8, or 9. I need to continue scrolling to find specific updates for these models.

Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: "Explore All Apple Watch";	[1]: "Apple Watch Series 11";	[2]: "Apple Watch SE 3";	[3]: "Apple Watch Ultra 3";	[4]: "Apple Watch Nike";	[5]: "Apple Watch Hermès";	[6]: "Compare Watch";	[7]: "Why Apple Watch";	[8]: "Shop Apple Watch";	[9]: "Apple Watch Bands";	[10]: "Apple Watch Accessories";	[11]: "Apple Watch Support";	[12]: "AppleCare";	[13]: "watchOS 26";

Confidence: 0.97

content: The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.
